# Tender Announcement for Nigel Bridge Abutment Reinforcement
[English and French Documents are available on the Government of Canada's tendering service,](https://www.canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities) under the solicitation number 5P468-23-0025/A.
## Brief Tender Description

Parks Canada requires a contractor to provide slope stabilisation, foundation drilling, and reinforcing to the abutment of Nigel Creek Bridge. The project involves slope and foundation repair on the south-west slope of the Nigel Creek Bridge, including but not limited to drilling, grouting, and net installation. See specifications and drawings for detailed requirements.

## Required Submission Information

Submitted bids must meet the following requirements:

* Emails must be addressed to soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca.
* Faxes can be sent to (855)983-1808.
* The maximum email file size is 15 megabytes. Consider resizing attachments to avoid emailing issues.
* Documents must be submitted as attachments, not through links.
* Separate emails are acceptable to avoid exceeding the 15-megabyte limit.

## Tender Details

* Tender Reference Number: cb-4671-82342128
* Tender Closing Date and Time: 2023-04-27 16:00:00 (Eastern Time)
* Expected Contract Start and End Dates: May 2, 2023, and September 30, 2023, respectively
* Estimated Project Value: Between $1,000,001 CAD and $5,000,000 CAD (excluding taxes)
* Solicitation Method: Competitive - Open Bidding

## Contact Information
For enquiries and clarifications, please contact Aarondeep Maan at aarondeep.maan@pc.gc.ca or (403)585-7139.

## Important Instructions

* Late submissions will not be considered.
* Addresses for service are indicated in the documentation package.
* Bonds and insurance requirements must be taken upon.
* Related services are being governed by the National Parks Regulations.

The Government of Canada maintains a procurement service at [www.canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities](https://www.canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities) for service and application under 5P468-23-0025/A. Inquiry calls are not available through direct contact with the authority, and all correspondence is best routed to the emails above.
